channel.title: News - South China Morning Post
channel.description: All the latest breaking news from Hong Kong, China and around the world

item.title: At least 8 killed in explosion at hotel in Cuba’s capital
item.description: The blast at the famous Hotel Saratoga in downtown Havana was not caused by a bomb, and a gas leak appears to be the most likely cause.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: US First Lady Jill Biden to meet Ukrainian refugees during border visit
item.description: On her second solo trip overseas Biden will visit Romania and Slovakia, where many Ukrainians have fled since Russia’s invasion of their country began; it is ‘so important to the president and to me that the Ukrainian people know we stand with them’.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: How John Lee’s election rally compares with those of other Hong Kong chief executive candidates
item.description: Some observers say Lee’s presentation lacked human touch compared with Carrie Lam’s in 2017 and Leung Chun-ying’s in 2011.
item.dc:creator: Gary Cheung,Chris Lau
item.author: Gary Cheung,Chris Lau

item.title: Hong Kong chief executive candidate John Lee vows to restore hope, build vibrant metropolis in ‘new chapter’ for city at final election rally
item.description: Former policeman offers rare glimpse into childhood, sharing story about how his father was able to afford luxury of buying television set.
item.dc:creator: Tony Cheung,Natalie Wong,Chris Lau,Nadia Lam
item.author: Tony Cheung,Natalie Wong,Chris Lau,Nadia Lam

item.title: Queen’s jubilee: Andrew, Harry, will not appear on Buckingham Palace balcony
item.description: British queen is soon marking 70 years on the throne but out-of-favour royals – her son Andrew and grandson Harry – will be excluded from the famous balcony scene.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: China hits out at Japanese PM’s five-nation tour of ‘confrontation’
item.description: Beijing says Kishida is hyping the ‘China threat’ and playing up regional tensions.
item.dc:creator: Shi Jiangtao
item.author: Shi Jiangtao

item.title: Hong Kong could get first offshore wind farm in 2027, providing carbon-free electric power to up to 120,000 families
item.description: HK Electric reveals plan to build 600-hectare wind farm, consisting of between 13 and 19 wind turbines, about 4km southwest off Lamma Island.
item.dc:creator: Ezra Cheung
item.author: Ezra Cheung

item.title: China inflation: Beijing prioritises price stabilisation as stagflation risk increases
item.description: China’s consumer price index (CPI) could rise to as much as 2.1 per cent in April from 1.5 per cent in March, with the World Bank warning of ‘the largest commodity shock we’ve experienced since the 1970s’.
item.dc:creator: Frank Tang
item.author: Frank Tang

item.title: UK police to investigate Labour leader over possible lockdown breach
item.description: Police previously looked into Keir Starmer and said there’d been no offence but on Friday said investigation opened as new information received; Labour Party said no rules were broken.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: Two dead in shooting at Dutch ‘care farm’
item.description: A 16-year-old girl and a 34-year-old woman were killed, say police, and two people seriously wounded in the incident near Rotterdam; it happened at farm where children, young people, adults with conditions like autism, Alzheimer’s work with animals as form of therapy.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: Ukraine war: China invokes 1999 Belgrade embassy bombing in attack on Nato expansion
item.description: China’s ambassador to the UN renews call for a peaceful resolution to the conflict.
item.dc:creator: Amber Wang
item.author: Amber Wang

item.title: China digital currency: leading mobile payment apps Alipay, WeChat Pay install new features to help widen e-CNY roll-out
item.description: That support reflects Big Tech companies’ commitment to help promote the country’s sovereign digital currency, following earlier initiatives by Meituan and JD.com.
item.dc:creator: Coco Feng
item.author: Coco Feng

item.title: China to send vice-president to new South Korean president’s inauguration
item.description: Wang Qishan’s visit comes as Beijing is watching to see if Yoon Suk-yeol will move South Korea closer to the US.
item.dc:creator: Teddy Ng,Shi Jiangtao
item.author: Teddy Ng,Shi Jiangtao

item.title: Hong Kong’s first Retail Green Bond sells out with US$4.2 billion in orders, auguring well for city’s role as funding hub for climate-friendly projects
item.description: The government’s inaugural green bond aimed at retail investors has been oversubscribed by 1.2 times, underlining the city’s potential as a major fundraising hub for environmentally friendly projects.
item.dc:creator: Enoch Yiu
item.author: Enoch Yiu

item.title: Belarus sentences Sofia Sapega, dissident’s plane arrest girlfriend, to 6 years in jail
item.description: Russian Sapega and Belarusian boyfriend Roman Protasevich were detained in 2021 after flight forced to land in Belarus; blogger Protasevich fled his nation in 2019 and became an editor at Poland-based Nexta Live channel, which is openly hostile to Lukashenko, the Belarus leader.
item.dc:creator: Reuters,Associated Press
item.author: Reuters,Associated Press

item.title: China’s US ambassador decries ‘political virus’ hurting bilateral economic ties between ‘natural partners’
item.description: Qin Gang blasts tariffs and says China is ‘mindful of more difficulties and challenges’ in trade and business with the United States.
item.dc:creator: Wendy Wu,Frank Tang
item.author: Wendy Wu,Frank Tang

item.title: China’s students to learn how to cook, clean and raise small animals to combat helpless maths nerd stereotype
item.description: Mainland education authorities worry growing trend towards a purely academic curriculum leaves Chinese students without basic domestic abilities and seeks to boost life skills.
item.dc:creator: Alice Yan
item.author: Alice Yan

item.title: Coronavirus can develop partial resistance to key treatment remdesivir, lab tests show
item.description: Scientists behind study say the experiment highlights the need to watch for real-life signs of drug resistance to ensure the treatment remains effective.
item.dc:creator: Holly Chik
item.author: Holly Chik

item.title: Hong Kong administrative officer denies link with prostitution syndicate, claims he booked hotel room for credit card points
item.description: James Lam, 30, assistant district officer in Sha Tin, says he booked room for about a month to earn points for credit card and hotel’s loyalty membership.
item.dc:creator: Clifford Lo
item.author: Clifford Lo

item.title: Hong Kong to establish new residential child care centre to tackle facilities shortage in wake of abuse scandal
item.description: Welfare minister Law Chi-kwong says city currently has limited capacity among providers of residential child care, invites more operators to join sector.
item.dc:creator: Fiona Sun
item.author: Fiona Sun

item.title: Ukraine war: Fresh UN effort to evacuate Mariupol civilians begins, says Ukraine
item.description: UN-brokered evacuations of some of hundreds of residents sheltering under steel plant had to stop after renewed fighting; ‘we’re praying for success of operation’ amid worry Russia may step up offensive before May 9, anniversary of Soviet Union’s WW2 victory over Nazi Germany.
item.dc:creator: Reuters,Agence France-Presse
item.author: Reuters,Agence France-Presse

item.title: Advisers to Hong Kong leader back 2.6 per cent pay rises for top officials, with No 2 official potentially earning HK$396,000
item.description: Independent commission suggests adjusting pay for senior officials in line with changes in average annual inflation since 2019.
item.dc:creator: Tony Cheung
item.author: Tony Cheung

item.title: China-Solomon Islands pact: Japan joins US, Australia in boosting Pacific islands engagement amid concerns
item.description: Foreign Minister Yoshimasa Hayashi’s trip comes in wake of deal that will reportedly allow Beijing to deploy forces and naval assets to the islands; also concerns about tactics Chinese police might use to maintain order.
item.dc:creator: Maria Siow
item.author: Maria Siow

item.title: Pentagon says Ukraine will not distract from Taiwan arms commitments
item.description: Weapons support to repel Russian invasion ‘will not’ shift US focus from its obligations to provide defence support to Taipei.
item.dc:creator: Teddy Ng
item.author: Teddy Ng

item.title: US-China tech war: shares of surveillance camera maker Hikvision plunge on second day after report of harsh sanctions
item.description: Investors rushed to dump shares of Hikvision after it was reported that the Chinese firm may be added to the Specially Designated Nationals list, which would bar it from dealing with American companies or citizens.
item.dc:creator: Yaling Jiang
item.author: Yaling Jiang

item.title: Quirky China: Porsche owners trash farm, quarantine in a phone booth for weeks and Shanghai couple have a huge online wedding
item.description: In this week’s Quirky China, four women in a Porsche trash a farm, a woman lived in a phone booth during Shanghai’s lockdown, and a couple have a massive online wedding.
item.dc:creator: Liya Su
item.author: Liya Su

item.title: Hong Kong hikers asked to help in search for missing Briton, who posted Facebook message before walking into country park
item.description: Shaun Connell has not been seen since Thursday morning and volunteers and police are searching Tai Tam Country Park.
item.dc:creator: Mark Agnew
item.author: Mark Agnew

item.title: Hong Kong Tourism Board’s campaign offering tours and staycation discounts returns amid eased social-distancing rules
item.description: Third round of campaign offering free tours and staycation discounts to more than 80,000 residents was initially suspended during fifth wave of infections.
item.dc:creator: Lo Hoi-ying
item.author: Lo Hoi-ying

item.title: Hong Kong policewoman admits to illegally soliciting loans worth HK$1.06 million
item.description: Constable Au Kar-man, 47, tried to secure HK$1 million from a restaurant owner and HK$60,000 from a man arrested for public brawling.
item.dc:creator: Brian Wong
item.author: Brian Wong

item.title: Coronavirus China: Japanese factories in Shanghai struggling to resume operations, survey shows
item.description: Shanghai Japanese Commerce & Industry Club survey showed that 63 per cent of factories had yet to resume operations after the financial hub implemented a citywide lockdown on April 1.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: Sun Hung Kai plans to build 9,940 flats at Yuen Long’s Tam Mei wetlands in one of Hong Kong’s biggest mass housing projects
item.description: The number of flats planned, equal to Hong Kong’s total home sales in the first seven months of 2021, is about the size of Whampoa Garden in Hung Hom, making it one of the city’s largest residential communities.
item.dc:creator: Lam Ka-sing
item.author: Lam Ka-sing

item.title: Adidas cuts profit target as China sales slump amid Covid-19 lockdowns across major market
item.description: Foreign brands are struggling to hang onto China as a growth driver after almost a year of consumer boycotts and preferential treatment for home-grown companies.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg
item.author: Bloomberg

item.title: Access to safe abortion still a struggle in Asia
item.dc:creator: Salomé Grouard
item.author: Salomé Grouard

item.title: As it happened: Hong Kong’s sole chief executive candidate gets backing from student, Olympian, business chief and ethnic minorities leader at high-profile rally
item.description: Election rally for Hong Kong’s sole chief executive candidate John Lee draws business tycoons and political heavyweights, as well as ordinary residents, two days before the city’s leadership poll.
item.dc:creator: SCMP Reporters
item.author: SCMP Reporters

item.title: Crisis-hit Sri Lanka goes on strike demanding government, president step down: ‘He must go’
item.description: All but one scheduled train service was cancelled on Friday as millions of the island’s workers stayed away from offices and factories in a strike organised by the trade union movement.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse,Associated Press
item.author: Agence France-Presse,Associated Press

item.title: Singapore convicts ‘masterminds’ behind US$6 billion penny-stock crash
item.description: The 2013 scandal, which saw stocks in three companies surge multiple times in the months before they slumped, battered investor confidence and led to a series of reforms to the city state’s stock trading rules.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: Coronavirus Hong Kong: airport to conduct rapid testing for overseas arrivals from May 9 to speed up entry procedures
item.description: Decision comes two days after European Chamber of Commerce calls Hong Kong’s airport entry process a ‘nightmare’ in letter to city leader.
item.dc:creator: Victor Ting,Cannix Yau,Ezra Cheung
item.author: Victor Ting,Cannix Yau,Ezra Cheung

item.title: UK PM Boris Johnson admits to ‘tough night’ in some places amid heavy losses in local elections
item.description: The Conservatives will find out in the coming days as votes are tallied whether they will be made to pay the price for Boris Johnson’s scandals.
item.dc:creator: Reuters,Associated Press,dpa
item.author: Reuters,Associated Press,dpa

item.title: Covid-19 in China: top-tier sporting events on hold in countdown to Communist Party’s national congress
item.description: Hangzhou was expected to host Asian Games in September but organisers say it will now take place at another time.
item.dc:creator: Phoebe Zhang,Guo Rui,SCMP Sport
item.author: Phoebe Zhang,Guo Rui,SCMP Sport

item.title: More mass Covid tests for Chinese capital’s worst-hit district to stop outbreak
item.description: Beijing logged 72 local infections on Friday, with around 40 per cent of cases in this outbreak detected in Chaoyang district.
item.dc:creator: Jane Cai
item.author: Jane Cai

item.title: South Africa’s daily Covid-19 cases soar 50 per cent in 24 hours amid new Omicron surge
item.description: The WHO chief said two Omicron sub-variants, BA.4 and BA.5, were behind the surge in cases in South Africa.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: Ukrainian troops unlikely to get easy exit from Mariupol’s Azovstal steel mill, experts say
item.description: Hundreds of Ukrainian fighters were still holed up at Mariupol’s sprawling Azovstal steelworks, the last pocket of resistance in a city largely reduced to rubble.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Video: John Lee gains nominations from more than half of Hong Kong’s chief executive Election Committee
item.dc:creator: SCMP Reporter
item.author: SCMP Reporter

item.title: Coronavirus: India slams WHO for 4.75 million pandemic death toll estimate – 10 times official count
item.description: The World Health Organization’s estimate is around 10 times the country’s official Covid-19 death toll for 2020-21. India’s health ministry said the world health body ‘conveniently chose to ignore the available data’.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: Video: Hong Kong leader Carrie Lam will not seek a second term as city’s chief executive
item.dc:creator: SCMP Reporter
item.author: SCMP Reporter

item.title: Hong Kong police arrest TVB employee over unauthorised notifications sent out via broadcaster’s news app
item.description: Man, 27, detained on suspicion of accessing a computer with dishonest intent – an offence that is punishable by up to five years in jail.
item.dc:creator: Clifford Lo
item.author: Clifford Lo

item.title: Pandemic, Ukraine war and China shutdowns top laundry list of global stagflation risk factors
item.description: On top of the obvious but potentially short-term stagflationary forces in play are far more structural, long-term issues that amplify the danger of protracted inflation and sharply reduced economic growth.
item.dc:creator: David Dodwell
item.author: David Dodwell

item.title: Coronavirus: Shanghai orders tests and standstill curbs in Jinshan after finding cases, doubling down on lockdowns as Xi defends China’s zero-Covid pursuit
item.description: The partial lockdown in Jinshan followed the discovery of two asymptomatic cases in quarantined areas, in setbacks for a district that claimed to have reached its so-called societal zero-Covid goal four days earlier.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Ren,Yaling Jiang
item.author: Daniel Ren,Yaling Jiang

item.title: US official: we gave intel before Ukraine sank Russian warship Moskva
item.description: New evidence emerged that the US provided intelligence that helped Ukraine sink a formidable Russian warship last month.
item.dc:creator: Agencies
item.author: Agencies

item.title: Japanese mass murderer’s fresh death penalty appeal rekindles capital punishment debate
item.description: Satoshi Uematsu, who was sentenced to death in 2020 for killing 19 people at a care home for the mentally disabled in 2016, is seeking a retrial.
item.dc:creator: Julian Ryall
item.author: Julian Ryall
